dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HRES 233 IH: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that Iran should immediately release the three United States citizens that it holds, as well as provide all known information on any United States citizens that have disappeared within its borders.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Kildee (for himself, Mr. Huffman, Mr. Deutch, Mr. Labrador, Mr. Engel, and Ms. Ros-Lehtinen) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that Iran should immediately release the three United States citizens that it holds, as well as provide all known information on any United States citizens that have disappeared within its borders.

whereas.text: Whereas three United States citizens have been held captive in Iran, some of them for multiple years;
Whereas one United States citizen disappeared in Iran over eight years ago; and
Whereas Iranian President Hassan Rouhani has stated that his government wishes to engage in a constructive interaction with the world: Now, therefore, be it

section.text: That it is the sense of the House of Representatives that Iran should release all detained United States citizens immediately and provide any information it possesses regarding any United States citizens that have disappeared within its borders.
